alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 8:36PM EST until December 17 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding along the Rocky River and Back Creek is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Cabarrus County, North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 415 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding will occur in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Streamflows will remain elevated overnight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 823 PM EST, Following widespread rainfall Sunday afternoon, the Rocky River above Irish Buffalo Creek is expected to rise above bankfull stage this evening, causing minor flooding mainly in poor drainage areas near the Rocky River and on some smaller creeks feeding into it. - Flooding from Back Creek may approach but not reach Pharr Mill Road due to backwater effects from Rocky River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Concord, Harrisburg, Mt Pleasant, Midland, and Fairview. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
